title: Unexpected cache related panic in nightly rust

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Hello everyone, I would like to report a bug. I have a project that throws the below error. However when I copy the entire project directory and build that copied directory, it compiles just fine. Therefore, I suppose this must be a caching issue. Unfortunately I was not able to extract a minimal example, as this issue is nondeterministic on the code base. I hope this helps :) ### Code ```Rust ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.59.0-nightly (78fd0f633 2021-12-29) binary: rustc commit-hash: 78fd0f633faaa5b6dd254fc1456735f63a1b1238 commit-date: 2021-12-29 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.59.0-nightly LLVM version: 13.0.0 ``` ### Error output ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'index out of bounds: the len is 145 but the index is 145', compiler/rustc_query_impl/src/on_disk_cache.rs:712:18 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.59.0-nightly (78fd0f633 2021-12-29) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type lib note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden ```
Backtrace

``` stack backtrace: 0: rust_begin_unwind at /rustc/78fd0f633faaa5b6dd254fc1456735f63a1b1238/library/std/src/panicking.rs:498:5 1: core::panicking::panic_fmt at /rustc/78fd0f633faaa5b6dd254fc1456735f63a1b1238/library/core/src/panicking.rs:107:14 2: core::panicking::panic_bounds_check at /rustc/78fd0f633faaa5b6dd254fc1456735f63a1b1238/library/core/src/panicking.rs:75:5 3: >::decode 4: >::decode 5: >::decode 6: ::read_seq::, as rustc_serialize::serialize::Decodable>::decode::{closure#0}> 7: >::decode 8: >::decode 9: <&rustc_middle::ty::TyS as rustc_serialize::serialize::Decodable>::decode 10: <&rustc_middle::ty::TyS as rustc_serialize::serialize::Decodable>::decode 11: as rustc_serialize::serialize::Decodable>::decode 12: , >::decode::{closure#0}> as rustc_middle::ty::context::InternAs<[rustc_middle::mir::ProjectionElem], &rustc_middle::ty::list::List>>>::intern_with::<::mk_place_elems, >::decode::{closure#0}>>::{closure#0}> 13: <(rustc_middle::mir::Place, rustc_middle::mir::Rvalue) as rustc_serialize::serialize::Decodable>::decode 14: ::read_seq::, as rustc_serialize::serialize::Decodable>::decode::{closure#0}> 15: ::read_seq::, as rustc_serialize::serialize::Decodable>::decode::{closure#0}> 16: >::decode 17: ::try_load_query_result::<&rustc_middle::mir::Body> 18: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::try_load_from_disk_and_cache_in_memory:: 19: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::try_execute_query::> 20: ::optimized_mir 21: ::instance_mir 22: rustc_monomorphize::collector::collect_neighbours 23: rustc_monomorphize::collector::collect_items_rec 24: ::time::<(), rustc_monomorphize::collector::collect_crate_mono_items::{closure#1}> 25: rustc_monomorphize::collector::collect_crate_mono_items 26: rustc_monomorphize::partitioning::collect_and_partition_mono_items 27: ::with_deps::<>::with_task_impl>, &[rustc_middle::mir::mono::CodegenUnit])> 29: rustc_data_structures::stack::ensure_sufficient_stack::<((&std::collections::hash::set::HashSet>, &[rustc_middle::mir::mono::CodegenUnit]), rustc_query_system::dep_graph::graph::DepNodeIndex), rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::execute_job>, &[rustc_middle::mir::mono::CodegenUnit])>::{closure#3}> 30:
